item.title: Diligent Robotics hires two notable Cruise alumni to its leadership team
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Diligent Robotics hired Cruise's former chief operating officer and former head of AI and robotics into c-suite positions.

item.title: Google announces latest AI American Infrastructure Acadmey cohort
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Google on Thursday announced the second cohort to take part in its AI Academy American Infrastructure Academy, which seeks to support companies using AI to address issues such as cybersecurity, education, and transportation.  The four-month program is designed for companies at a seed to Series A stage and provides equity-free support and resources like leadership […]

item.title: Trump taps transportation secretary Sean Duffy as acting NASA chief
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description: President Donald Trump appointed Secretary of Transportation Sean Duffy to lead NASA.

item.title: Cameo’s birthday reminder app, Candl, is a weak attempt at a comeback
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: With new birthday app Candl, Cameo is exploring a new, albeit dull, avenue for growth.

item.title: Samsung to launch a triple-folding phone this year
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: After releasing two new foldables, Samsung is aiming to release a trifold device this year.

item.title: Google brings its AI-powered marketing tools to India after ‘Google tax’ repeal
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Google has launched a suite of its AI-powered advertising tools in India, which debuted in the U.S. in May, as the repeal of the so-called “Google tax” has made the South Asian market more attractive to global tech firms selling online ads. In March, the Indian government scrapped its 6% levy on digital advertisements, effective […]

item.title: Elon Musk’s xAI launches Grok 4 alongside a $300 monthly subscription
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Elon Musk’s AI company, xAI, late on Wednesday released its latest flagship AI model, Grok 4, and unveiled a new $300-per-month AI subscription plan, SuperGrok Heavy. Grok is xAI’s answer to models like OpenAI’s ChatGPT and Google’s Gemini, and can analyze images and respond to questions. In recent months, Grok has become more deeply integrated into Musk’s social […]

item.title: Why Cluely’s Roy Lee isn’t sweating cheating detectors
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Cluely, the startup that until recently marketed itself as a "cheat on everything" tool, is moving away from cheating.

item.title: Microsoft shares $500M in AI savings internally days after cutting 9,000 jobs
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Microsoft’s chief commercial officer Judson Althoff noted AI has been so useful that Microsoft was able to save more than $500 million last year in its call center alone.

item.title: California lawmaker behind SB 1047 reignites push for mandated AI safety reports
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: California State Senator Scott Wiener on Wednesday introduced new amendments to his latest bill, SB 53, that would require the world's largest AI companies to publish safety and security protocols and issue reports when safety incidents occur.

item.title: Steve Davis left DOGE in May, but officials say he’s still running the show
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Though he officially left the U.S. government in May, Steve Davis -- Elon Musk's low-flying former top lieutenant at the Department of Government Efficiency -- continues wielding influence at DOGE, according to the WSJ. The outlet says Davis regularly gives directions to current DOGE officials and has privately dismissed his departure as "fake news."

item.title: Neobank Revolut seeks $65B valuation, a year after its $45B deal
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Europe’s fintech darling Revolut is looking to raise a new funding round that would give it a $65 billion valuation, the Financial Times reports. The U.K.-based company is reportedly in talks to raise around $1 billion by issuing new shares and selling existing ones. The U.S.-based firm Greenoaks is said to be leading the round, […]

item.title: X’s ad business improved under departing CEO Linda Yaccarino, but it’s still tough times ahead
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: In the U.S., ad spending was up 62% year-over-year in the first half of 2025.

item.title: OpenAI is reportedly releasing an AI browser in the coming weeks
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: OpenAI's browser is said to use AI to rethink how users browse the web, keeping some user interactions inside ChatGPT instead of linking out to websites.

item.title: Jack Dorsey says his ‘secure’ new Bitchat app has not been tested for security
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: Dorsey admitted that his new messaging app had not been reviewed or tested for security issues prior to its launch.

item.title: YouTube prepares crackdown on ‘mass-produced’ and ‘repetitive’ videos, as concern over AI slop grows
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: YouTube's creator liaison said the change is a "minor" update to YouTube's longstanding policies.

item.title: ChatGPT hallucinated about music app Soundslice so often, the founder made the lie come true
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Adrian Holovaty, founder of music-teaching platform Soundslice, finally solved a months-long mystery: weird images of ChatGPT sessions kept being uploaded to the site.

item.title: Apple looks to bid on becoming US home for Formula 1
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: This latest news comes as Apple enjoys its first blockbuster in-theaters hit with its new F1 movie, produced by F1 star Lewis Hamilton.

item.title: How startups are rewriting the late-stage playbook at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: David George of a16z joins the Going Public stage at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025, Moscone West in San Francisco, from October 27–29. Register now.

item.title: Blok is using AI personas to simulate real-world app usage
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Blok allows developers to use AI to simulate different user personas to test an app's features and learn how to make their apps better.
